elements.name: question1
elements.title: What are the characteristics of a specialist store?
elements.correctAnswer: A specialist store stocks a large selection of items from a product group in different price ranges with complementary services.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: How does a specialty store differ from a specialist store?
elements.correctAnswer: The specialty store specializes in a section of the product range of a specialist store.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What are the characteristics of a supermarket?
elements.correctAnswer: Supermarkets offer a range of products suitable for self-service and often have a low price level.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: How do you describe a specialist store?
elements.correctAnswer: Specialty stores are large businesses that concentrate on a few product groups (sectors) and offer a very wide range of products. They are often conveniently located and have a large sales area. The price level tends to be low.

elements.name: question12
elements.title: What characterizes a department store?
elements.correctAnswer: A department store works on the principle of "everything under one roof". It has a broad and deep product range, distinctive customer services, elaborate facilities and a medium to high price level. Department stores are large-scale operations.

elements.name: question13
elements.title: Why do shopping centers use buzzwords like "shopping experience" and "fun" in their advertising?
elements.correctAnswer: Shopping centers want to turn shopping into a leisure activity.

elements.name: question14
elements.title: What is a convenience store?
elements.correctAnswer: Convenience stores sell everyday consumer goods and consumables. They often have extended opening hours and are also open on Sundays and public holidays.
